intro: Silene nodulosa, commonly known as the knotted catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs. Silene nodulosa is characterized by its unique, knotted appearance, which gives it its common name. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open grasslands and woodland edges.
